description:
Randou Rino is a young girl with a head full of air and a talking puppet on her hand. She is accepted into the illustrious Gokujou all-girl's school, and is summarily, almost curiously, accepted as part of the even more illustrious Gokujou Student Council, who has more power and business ventures than most large businesses. Now a part of the student council, she befriends the talented members of the Gokujou Student Council, leaving one to wonder how a girl with seemingly no talents or redeeming qualities would get chosen for such a group.

(Source: Anime News Network)

node.description:
__Non-anime roles:__
- Shenhe - Genshin Impact (VG)

__Hobbies:__ making ribbon bows and sweets, writing poems, Phantasy Star Online

[Website](http://www.tamurayukari.com) | [Profile](http://amuleto.jp/talents/tamura_yukari.html) | [Music Profile](http://www.kingrecords.co.jp/cs/artist/artist.aspx?artist=15412) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/yukari_tamura) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yukari_Tamura) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%94%B0%E6%9D%91%E3%82%86%E3%81%8B%E3%82%8A) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@OfficialChannel-eu5sl)

She is a popular Japanese singer-songwriter and voice actress (seiyuu), currently affiliated with Amuleto (as seiyuu) and with King Records (as songstress). Affectionately called Yukarin by her fans, she is also known for her soft voice and interest in Lolita fashion. She made her debut as a voice actress in 1997, releasing her debut single Yuuki wo Kudasai on March 26, 1997.
While also a well-known seiyuu, several of her releases have been used as opening and ending themes for anime series, while some have reached the Oricon top 100 singles and album charts. Her role as Takamachi Nanoha in the Magical Girl Lyrical Nanoha series contributed to a rise in her popularity, as several of her singles (Little Wish: Lyrical Step, Spiritual Garden, Hoshizora no Spica, Beautiful Amulet) were used as the ending themes for the franchise's anime adaptations.

Non-Anime Roles
- Nahida (Genshin Impact) [VG]
- Qiqi (Genshin Impact) [VG]
- Theresa Apocalypse (Honkai Impact 3rd) [VG]
- Vita Clotilde - The Legend of Heroes Series [VG]
- Yvette - Strinova [VG]

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

A close personal friend of [Kozue Amano](https://anilist.co/staff/96937/Kozue-Amano). She was invited on stage to Anime Festival Asia 2011.

In 2013, she married a man from outside the anime industry.

__Non anime roles:__

- Changli - Wuthering Waves (VG)
- Castorice - Honkai Star Rail (VG)
- Metis - Persona 3 Reload : Episode Aigis -The Answer (VG)

Tomoko Kawakami was a Japanese voice actress. Having graduated from the Toho Gakuen College of Drama and Music, she was affiliated with Production Baobab at the time of her death.

In August 2008, Kawakami was diagnosed with ovarian cancer, which required surgery. During a three-year battle with cancer, most of her ongoing roles were replaced by other voice actresses, although the latter was able to do some voice work until her retirement in the start of the 2010s decade. She died on June 9, 2011 at the age of 41.

__Height:__ 154 cm (5' 0")
__Hobbies:__ Piano

[Profile](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/sawashiro-miyuki.html) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miyuki_Sawashiro) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%B2%A2%E5%9F%8E%E3%81%BF%E3%82%86%E3%81%8D)

Began her voice-acting career in 1999 and has continued her work as a seiyuu for more than two decades. Her younger brother [Chiharu Sawashiro](https://anilist.co/staff/120159) is a fellow voice actor.

Yousuke Kuroda is a Japanese screenwriter. He is affiliated with Studio Orphee and serves as the inside director (board of directors member).

Kuroda is a prolific writer in the anime industry. Having authored and scripted numerous anime series. Including several original productions. Some of the most notable are Infinite Ryvius, Scryed, Please☆Teacher!, Mobile Suit Gundam 00, and Waiting in the Summer.

In 2003, he won the Individual Award at the 8th Animation Kobe event.

Longtime video game composer for Square Co., Ltd. and arguably one of the most prolific female game composers in the world, Yoko Shimomura is behind the music for games such as Legend of Mana and Parasite Eve. She is likely best known for her work on the Kingdom Hearts series and the Mario & Luigi series.
Known to be a fast and efficient worker. Often directing multiple works at a time.

John Ledford is an entrepreneur and leader in the North American anime industry. In 1992, he founded A.D. Vision (ADV), paving the way for other businesses and the exponential growth anime has had within North America. With ADV's success, Ledford turned his sights to making the imaginative world of anime even more accessible with Anime Network's founding, North America’s first cable TV network dedicated to anime. He later partnered with Kadokawa Publishing and began Newtype USA with translated Japanese content and exclusive U.S. material related to all things anime, manga, and model reviews. This endeavor expanded into ADV Manga, which obtained licensing and publishing rights for hundreds of Japanese manga and Korean manhwa.

In 2008, Ledford founded a new anime-focused company called Sentai Filmworks (Sentai). Since its founding, Sentai provides thousands of hours of content across traditional and digital platforms. Sentai’s dedication to bringing captivating stories, including acclaimed titles such as Grave of the Fireflies, Ninja Scroll, and High School of the Dead to audiences, is ongoing.

Ledford’s most recent success is with the 2017 founding of the streaming service HIDIVE. Since launching, HIDIVE is now available via a web browser, mobile devices, gaming platforms, and more. HIDIVE offers new simulcasts every season, an ever-growing collection of dubs, and exclusive titles. The service features DUBCAST SM editions, early access local-language dubs of simulcasts directly produced by HIDIVE, as early as two weeks after the original Japanese broadcast.

For nearly thirty years now, Ledford continues his goal to further the expansion of anime and the Japanese culture as a whole.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/松倉友二)

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/) since 1992, where he currently serves as the Executive Officer and General Manager of Production Headquarters. Also the representative director of Jam Creation.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YooheySuzuki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鈴木洋平_(アニメ演出家))

Youhei Suzuki is a director and former director of photography formerly working for [J.C.Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/JC-Staff). Currently freelance.

Not to be confused with the producer of the same name Youhei Suzuki (鈴木洋平).
